result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Allister Maple was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Allister Maple is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark Allister Maple was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CM325,15CM406,15CM440 and 15CM519:
  CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Timothy Joseph O'Brien   DF:  Mark Allister Maple appeared. Case called at 10:10 a.m. Atty O'Brien recites the agreement.    Court reads charge and maximum penalty. In file 15CM406,  DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 3. In file 15CM440, DE pleads GUILTY to Ct's 1 and 5.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 3 in 15CM406 and in file 15CM440, court finds DE GUILTY to Ct's 1 and 5. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses 15CM325 and 15CM519 in it's entirety. In file 15CM406, court dismisses Ct's 1 and 2. In file 15CM440, court dismisses Ct's 2,3 & 4.  Sentencing arguments. State has complied with victims rights. DE's wife makes statement. DE makes statement. Court will reserve on jail credit. 20 days to file appeal.  Crt orders:

Count 3 in 15CM406:

- S/W 18 months probation. Concurrent to 15CM440. Report to probation by 1 p.m. today. Bond will continue until reports to probation. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Court costs to be paid over the course of probation. Bond on file to apply. Any remaining funds on file to be refunded.

-  Not to use or possess firearms.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.



Counts 1 and 5 in 15CM440:

- S/W 18 months probation. Concurrent to 15CM406. Report to probation by 1 p.m. today. Bond will continue until reports to probation. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Court costs to be paid over the course of probation. Bond on file to apply. Any remaining funds on file to be refunded.

-  Not to use or possess firearms.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- Crt permits random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: LiddleADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Timothy Joseph O'Brien   DF:  Mark Allister Maple appeared. Includes 15CM325, 15CM440 and 15CM406. Case called at 2:38 pm. Atty O'Brien makes statement. No objection from ADA Hartung. M. Maple makes statement. Court modifies bond to No Abusive Contact.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:45 am.

and X__ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $2,500.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

Includes 15CM325, 15CM440 and 15CM406

- $1,000 CASH BOND ON FILE

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, M. Maple and Robert C.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-No possession of firearms. 

-Report every Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for PBT testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  May also be done at the New Richmond Police Department.

- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.

and   _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $2250.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

-Needs a plan in place and proof before release. 


-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Melissa M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-No possession of firearms. 

-Report every Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for PBT testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  May also be done at the New Richmond Police Department.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.


Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Sharon Correll,  DF ATTY: Timothy O'Brien,  DF:  Mark Allister Maple appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Reserves speedy trial.  ADA Correll requests $500.00 CB, 4500.00 SIBS. Atty O'Brien argues and would like the NC lifted per Victim. Court may reconsider bond if plans are in place.   QUASH WARRANT.  Status conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
